name: BEST WESTERN Cwrt Bleddyn Hotel & Spa

reviews.text: Stayed 3 nights in the beautifully located hotel and was made to feel welcome by all staff from the moment I walked into reception. I was given the Eleanor Bond Suite which was impressive and clean. I was slightly disappointed that the room had no detail on who Eleanor Bond was and I tasked reception to find out (none of the girls over two of the days could find out anything but the very friendly barman managed to get the answer for them).
reviews.title: Mae croeso cynnes iawn a chyfeillgar

reviews.text: Evening meals were very good, first night I opted for the Bream and was not disappointed, I almost went for it a second evening but had been recommended to try the beef wellington - this was cooked to perfection.
reviews.title: Perfect venue for a weeding.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has a good selection of leasure facilities (gym, swimming pool etc) again the staff there are as friendly as the main hotel.
reviews.title: Could so easily be much better

reviews.text: Would I go back? Yes; would I recommend this? Yes.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel in Idyllic Location

reviews.text: Stayed one night for a weeding. Staff were very friendly from the receptionist to the waiters nothing was to much trouble. The room we were given (18) was a good size and spotlessly clean. The bed was really comfortable. The food we were served at the weeding was really good and all arrived really hot. The drinks were a little pricey but not rip off prices. I would definitely recommend this hotel for a weeding venue.
reviews.title: Nice location and rooms, poor staffing and very expensive
Good location, rooms a bit tired
reviews.text: Stayed in one of the annexe rooms and whilst this was nice and quiet the bathroom fan didn't work so the room steamed up, and the quality of the bathroom just seemed a bit cheap. Bed was comfortable and even with the wedding we stayed for still going on, had a good sleep. We ordered breakfast in bed but this didn't turn up at the requested time, and after a phone call to reception took a while to still arrive.. They didn't charge us for the delivery but not sure if this was a mistake or a gesture of goodwill.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely location though but bar drinks seemed very expensive for the area. Probably give it a miss for a return stay..
reviews.title: Lovely stay only if the customer service was better!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recently stayed at the Cwrt Bleddyn for a nice relaxing get away with my partner as I arrived at the hotel I was met with a lady at reception who I think her name was Amy? also with Amy was a small child sat behind the reception desk I do realise it is half term but bringing your children to work when you work in a hotel is really unprofessional as they were messing around behind the desk and then later on I rang down to the hotel and the little girl answered the phone!! I really could not believe this surely this child should not be behind the desk for this reason!!
reviews.title: Friendly staff, great food, lovely gardens

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I stayed here a few weeks ago. The building is a bit pink but apart from that we had an enjoyable two nights stay. Spacious room, staff were helpful and breakfast and dinner were very good. Mind you, the two day stay was made even more enjoyable because we booked it via a Daily Mirror offer. Two nights for the two of us, £30 per room per night. Excellent breakfast, £5.99 each...job done!!!
reviews.title: Odd!

reviews.text: We stayed here for one night in an annex room. The room was clean and basic, plenty of space but unfortunate for us we could hear the tv from the room below us way into the early hours and from around 6am... Not great!
reviews.title: Nothing special once you get inside.

reviews.text: Pleasant stay in countryside hotel while visiting the area. Room very good, quite spacious, bed very comfortable. As I am a light sleeper was pleased to hear no noise from other areas in the hotel. There was also a wedding one night I stayed - but was pleasantly surprised that I heard no noise from this at all. Used the lovely good sized pool and Jacuzzi. Staff very pleasant and helpful - complimentary towels available. Pool and Jacuzzi temperature just lovely. I found the dimmed lighting in the pool area very relaxing after a day out walking. The breakfast was good - cooked to order and a good choice too. Breakfast staff were very pleasant and helpful as well. Bar area looked comfortable - but didn't use it. Would just say the corridor areas could do with a lick of paint and the courtyard area needs checking perhaps more regularly for used items and cigarette butts. Would definitely stay here again if visiting the area.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay in quiet countryside hotel

reviews.text: I have just spent four nights and 5 days with my partner and another couple of friends at this wonderful hotel near Usk. The hotel is beautiful, and our rooms were wonderful: our friends' (32)had a queen-sized bed with overhanging canopy and ours (35) was a massive suite underneath the roof, with spectacular sloping ceilings and dark wooden beams. The split-level bathroom was very old-fashioned and stylish, again with sloping ceilings and a beautiful washstand. I've never loved a hotel room as much as the one here...For another reviewer to complain about creaking floorboards: it's hundreds of years old; what would you expect?!! We had a deal for dinner to be incuded in our stay.The menu was extensive, with several choices, and an unusually high vegetarian selection for myself. Our lovely server Kate was extremely knowledgeable and efficient, and they are very accommodating about specific diertary requirements. The spa and pool facilities were extremely good. The large pool was a little warmer than is usual, which suited me immeasurably! The sauna was top notch, and firing on all cylinders even on the mornings I went for an early swim.
reviews.title: One of THE best hotels ever!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: None of us had been to south Wales before, and this was an ideal spot to explore places like Usk, Chepstow, Newport, Abergevenny, Merthyr Tydfil and Hay-on-Wye. The Brecon Mountain Railway is definitely a great afternoon out, and the Roman Amphitheatre at nearby Caerleon was truly spectacular.
reviews.title: Not very Impressed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To sum up: we couldn't fault this hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful, the food first-class and the rooms wonderful. The location is tranquil and scenic, and the prices reasonable.
reviews.title: Fabulous relaxing break

reviews.text: Absolutely first-class and thoroughly recommended without any hesitation.
reviews.title: Could do a lot better.................
Let down by housekeeping
reviews.text: Stayed for two nights in July. Initial impression quite good; room was large as was en-suite but gradually poor housekeeping began to outweigh the pleasure.
Good points were the space, the large comfortable bed, dining room service and, by and large, the food.
reviews.title: Top Class Value for Money One Night Business Stay

reviews.text: Against this there were numerous failed lightbulbs in the room and public areas, the floral displays in the flower beds needed weeding, there was a torn sheet and torn duvet cover on the bed, the bathroom extractor didn't work, the TV was virtually impossible to switch on or off by the remote control and the manual controls had been disabled. Annoyingly the cleaning regime for the bar was undertaken when everyone was taking breakfast so the access to the dining room was impeded by a wet floor and the accompanying warning cones. To top that the hoovering was undertaken in the public areas at the busiest time in reception when folk were checking out or breakfasting. The distressed look furniture in the bedroom looked dated and the smart and large bathroom was a triumph of form over function.
reviews.title: Relaxing retreat

reviews.text: Cwrt Bleddyn has it all good helpful staff, fantastic views, great comfortable rooms the usual coffee and tea making facilities but plenty of everthing, good food,I chose to eat at the bar and the chicken special in ciabatta was very good, the breakfast was cooked to order fantastic!, for the business traveller free wi fi and a desk in the room. The Spa & Gym are also excellent.
reviews.title: Buisness trip

reviews.text: I will visit again for sure both business and pleasure.
reviews.title: Excellent
